intro: Berkheya pechuelii, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a South African plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features bright yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk, which gives it a striking appearance. It is native to the Western and Eastern Cape provinces of South Africa. Berkheya pechuelii thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
